{"step_by_step_thinking": "Amelogenesis imperfecta is a group of rare genetic conditions affecting the structure and appearance of the enamel of the teeth. The KLK4 gene provides instructions for making a protein that is involved in the maturation of enamel. Mutations in this gene disrupt the normal maturation of enamel, leading to a specific type of amelogenesis imperfecta known as hypomaturation amelogenesis imperfecta.", "answer_choice": "B.
